similaranime.anime: Honzuki no Gekokujou: Shisho ni Naru Tame ni wa Shudan o Erande Iraremasen

recommendations.recommendation: This series is... Different, at least given its intentional demographic target of children. Very flawed in its way and can probably only be enjoyed by the specially interested, but taking a quick look at the first five episodes shouldn`t kill anyone.

Hearth-taking fantasy anime with slow plot development, simple but nice animation and realistically written characters (no super-heros). Also dividing the plot into three timespans makes this anime a bit unique. And the less you know about the story (beware trailers and AMV), the better enjoyment you will get.

Not a typical anime for the general audience. But one of great storyline and character development. Having said so, this was screened on NHK-E, so this carries certain level of family and heart-felt emotions during the course of the story. Great for those who are into plot and character development than action.
Starts slow as its been said, but that actually helps to get into the story. Although it has 1 recap or 2 that could be avoided and the ending could be better for this anime. Really recommended
Very well done tragedy. Never thought I would be interested in such a thing, but gives me a better feeling than a typical classic Disney movie.
Dropped once,but then got back and really liked it.Supreme music and a nice theme,though the art can be better(I.G. were lazy).
Masterpiece, can`t find any other way to say it!
The story to this anime was just phenomenal...
not the usual fantasy with unfuckable-main-character-only-fighting thing. feelings are strong in this. I strongly recommend the watch to everyone who can watch things different from dragonball :)
Masterpiece. Do not miss this one!
Quite slow at first; but develops into a very interesting story. Reminds me of The Twelve Kingdoms.

the series had way too many recycled cut scenes that i ended up skipping over towards the end because i wanted to know how the plot progresses. the story and character development of erin is a master piece. take your time and enjoy.

Music that soothes, story that moves and a perfect balance in storytelling which gives you a solid ride for 50 episodes. Kemono no souja Erin is filled with warm emotions and sadness, and the pacing is gentle but still steadily builds up to the climax.
No loose ends, this is a perfect example of how to direct an anime. It`s simply a masterpiece.
Epic, beautiful, great story, must see!

I`ve never seen better anime depicting human x animal relationship with such a strong female lead and especially topic of using beasts in a war. Although the show gets annoying sometimes because of all those recaps and slow-pacing, it is highly recommended. ;)
At first I was reluctant because it seems focused to a pretty young audience. But when I read it shares novelist with Moribito I gave it a try. Veredict: masterpiece
A show feeling similar with animes like "Guardian of the Spirit" or "Twelve Kingdoms" and as great as them. Don`t be fooled and judge by the title picture on this site ;)

anime.description: * Based on the fantasy novel series written by http://anidb.net/cr6977 [Uehashi Nahoko]. Kemono no Souja Erin is about a young woman who is drawn into a war between kingdoms. 10-year-old http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin] is a young girl who lives with her mother in the Tai Koh Region in the small Village of Ake. She has a big love for animals, especially the Touda, dragon-like creatures used in the war. Her mother http://anidb.net/ch7453 [Soyon] was originally of the Mist People, an ancient clan who have members with green hair and eyes, and is rumored to follow in the ancient ways, practice magic, and hide in the mist. But despite her genealogy, they stay in the village because Erin`s late father was the son of the village chief and Soyon is the head Touda doctor. One day however a tragedy happens which changes Erin`s life forever.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: elementary school
tag.description: The term elementary school is used in some countries for schools where children from the age of about five receive primary education.

tag.name: energetic
tag.description: An energetic character, often also called a genki character, shows great, often excessive levels of activity or vitality, and seems to always be doing everything extra fast. Genki characters are often slightly, or sometimes very, eccentric, and are filled with confidence and determination, regardless of whether they are competent or not; in fact, they often have little to no actual competence at whatever they generally do. Although genki characters are usually played exclusively for comedy effect, sometimes they may slow down for a serious or introspective moment. The most common genki character archetype is the genki schoolgirl, who will often be late to school and run with a toast in her mouth.

tag.name: mask
tag.description: Masks are items normally worn on the face. Their uses range from medical (example: oxygen mask) to disguise (avoiding recognition). They can also be used for entertainment (for example, in theater or dance), and may even be forced upon someone as punishment. Masks have been in use since ancient times.

tag.name: xenophobia
tag.description: An intense dislike and/or fear of people from other countries.

tag.name: corrupt
tag.description: The character is spiritually or morally impure and may accept payment or other benefits for services or material which the recipient is not due, under law.

tag.name: orphan
tag.description: The character (in common usage: only a child, or the young of an animal) has lost both parents.

tag.name: suicidal
tag.description: The character has suicidal tendencies.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: trauma
tag.description: Character with emotional or psychological injury, caused by single or multiple events/experiences in the past.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: dark fantasy
tag.description: Focus set on darker themes in a fantasy setting, sometimes leaning towards horror elements. Bleak and pessimistic tones often dominate. Dark supernatural beings like vampires may play a significant role.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: toilet humour
tag.description: Everything leads back to poo.

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: feudal warfare
tag.description: Feudal Warfare is the warfare of the Middle Ages and therefore the setting must take place in a time line similar to that of Middle Ages or its Asian/American counterparts, or in a fantasy world. Generally it can be described the same way as the Military category, just that the weapons used are swords, spears, bows, catapults, cannons and other weapons used in the Middle Ages. Note: Just because the anime contains a guy or a couple of guys with swords wondering about, doesn`t make it applicable for this category, unless there are larger military organizations/groups involved in armed conflict with each other, you might not want to add this genre.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: horror
tag.description: The horror cinematic genre is characterized by the attempt to make the viewer experience dread, fear, terror, or horror. Often their plots involve the intrusion of an evil force, event or personage, sometimes of supernatural origin, on the mundane world and the consequences thereof.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: anti-war
tag.description: The anime portrays the insanity of war.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: law and order
tag.description: Where there is "wealth", there are criminals. It is up to the civil law enforcement, i.e. detectives, Police or Special Squads, to keep the lawless activities in the real world or in cyberspace under control. Note: Do not confuse this with Military presence.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: special squads
tag.description: The Special Squads are called in when the police is completely outclassed, e.g. fighting criminal syndicates. These special forces are trained to combat specific forms of crime, e.g. the anti-cyber-crime division. There are several such squads: Whereas Section 9 of Ghost in the Shell is an official government organisation, there are also "benevolent" vigilante groups like the Knight Sabers (Bubblegum Crisis). Criminal syndicates also have their special forces e.g. "death squads".

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: dreamworld trip
tag.description: A dreamworld trip is a "visit" to a dreamworld, a place that only exists in the mind of an asleep and dreaming person, or, more generally, any place in someone`s mind or other world that isn`t part of reality; in anime, this means the characters` reality, not our own.

tag.name: fairy tale
tag.description: This anime is either based on or contains parts of fairy tales. Usually those parts are highly modified or twisted when compared with the original source.

tag.name: parricide
tag.description: Parricide, or the murder of family members, is the act of taking the life of of one or more of one`s own close family members, or even one`s entire family; that may include spouses, parents, grandparents, children, grandchildren, siblings, cousins, uncles, aunts, nephews, and nieces, among others.

tag.name: eating of humans
tag.description: The eating of humans, also called man-eating, is the practice of some species to prey on human beings for nourishment. Examples of possible hunters may include Earth animals, alien species, zombies or other undead, and so forth. Eating of humans is not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t3815 [human cannibalism]; the former is about other species eating people, while the latter is about humans eating fellow humans.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: footage reuse
tag.description: Footage reuse is the employment of a sequence of frames many times, generally as a side effect of a constrained anime production budget. This can happen by using the same footage once at a time, but many times over the course of the show, or by directly looping it. Types of scenes that tend to get reused include: transformations, such as those typical of superheroes or magical girls, characters that change into powered-up versions of themselves, or robots changing shape; attacks, especially when involving a series of steps that must be followed before the attack can be launched; and any kind of action that involves repeating the same movement. This tag does not apply if the footage changes significantly between iterations. An example of that is the infamous Endless Eight arc of http://anidb.net/a6367 [the 2009 iteration of Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]; even as the plot repeated itself, each episode of the arc showed it in different ways.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: symbolism
tag.description: Representation of a more complex concept by a simple thing. Like a red flower for love or a flag for a nation.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: hostage situation
tag.description: One or more characters in this anime are taken hostage, to pressure or blackmail other involved parties. A person given as a pledge or security for the performance of the conditions of a treaty or stipulations of any kind, on the performance of which the person is to be released. (Source: Wiktionary)

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: human-animal relationship
tag.description: The relationship between a human and an animal (or an animal-like creature like a dragon) plays an important role in the plot of this anime.

tag.name: family values
tag.description: Family values are traditional or cultural values, generally conservative in nature, that pertain to the family`s structure, function, roles, beliefs, attitudes, and ideals. They encompass a set of beliefs, the most common of which is the classical "traditional family" involving a middle-class family with a breadwinner father and a homemaker mother, raising their biological children. According to Merriam-Webster, family values are "values especially of a traditional or conservative kind which are held to promote the sound functioning of the family and to strengthen the fabric of society." Source: English Wikipedia

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: slow-paced
tag.description: The story — including its characters and events — develop slowly. May contain a weak continuity of plot and/or character development. Or may be a story telling device to increase the "sense of foreboding" in an anime with thriller or horror setting.

tag.name: girly tears
tag.description: Usually girly tears are the ones not shed by men (duh). Like when a (stereotypical) girl watches something and cries her makeup out, a (stereotypical) dude just says, proclaiming his masculinity: "Meh, yet another soap opera bulls..t, I`ll be in my garage fixing my ride while playing heavy metal on a burning guitar ...with my teeth! And where`s my beer, woman?". So that`s how it goes: girly tears are for girls and sissies! Chuck Norris forbid a guy would weep watching something that has this tag! Now 20 push-ups! P.S. The opposite of "manly tears". Or is it? Let`s face it - it`s all subjective (and relative, and context-dependent).

tag.name: heroic sacrifice
tag.description: "In order to save the many, the few will need to sacrifice their lives..." or so this character may think. In a seemingly hopeless situation, against impossible odds, the character does not choose the path of the coward and run, he or she chooses to bravely face the enemy, fully aware that this will mean death.

tag.name: hallucination
tag.description: Hallucinations can occur when excessive amount of drugs (normally illegal) are consumed / injected / smoked. A person hallucinating cannot differentiate between reality & falsehoods. Surroundings & environment looks crazy, bright and colourful. Everything seems to be moving.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Erin
character.description: Erin is a 10-years-old girl, described as kind, collected, earnest, and very observant. Due to the influence of her mother http://anidb.net/ch7453 [Soyon], she carries a unique perspective in caring for beasts. Many people think that she is too curious, which simply gets her in trouble. Erin is truly caring towards people and animals, even to the point of worrying more about others than herself. She is strongly against using the Touda for war and dreams that one day humans and beasts may understand each other and that beasts would not be bound by human`s codes. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Soyon
character.description: The mother of Erin, a Touda doctor of the Village of Ake. She was originally a woman of the Mist People, but left her original heritage when she married Asson, the son of the chief of Ake Village. However, Asson passed away early, and left his wife and unborn child to live in the village. Despite her being of the Mist people, Soyon was a gifted beastenarian and was given special permission to care for the village`s Touda. She decides to train her daughter Erin to be a Touda vet without teaching her the Mist People`s forbidden techniques. Soyon is executed when the Kiba Touda die in the ponds, in episode 7. Afterwards she appears many times in Erin`s memories, especially in memories of teaching Erin the art of animal breeding.

character.name: Lilan
character.description: A female Ohju that Erin takes care of in Kazalm. She is "raised" by Erin, who later sees her as her mother and is the only human Lilan is accustomed to.

character.name: Ial
character.description: Ial is one of the http://anidb.net/ch16877 [Queen]`s personal bodyguards, the Sezan, and also one of the few the Royal Family trusts personally. He takes his job, protecting the Queen and http://anidb.net/ch16876 [the Princess], very seriously. He is known throughout the nation as "Godspeed Ial" for his ability to run at an inhuman pace. Ial acts cold and unsociable around others, even to his comrades and http://anidb.net/ch16937 [his mentor]. However he has a soft spot for http://anidb.net/ch93797 [Erin], who is the only person he mostly smiles at and knows of his past. For her safety, he tries to keep his distance from her. He later becomes one of the few people who knows Erin`s dark past, and promises that he`ll keep quiet about it until the time is ready. There are hints showing that Ial seems to be in love with Erin.

character.name: Damiya
character.description: Duke Damiya is http://anidb.net/ch16877 [Queen]`s nephew and the leader of the Psi-Gamul. He is very secretive and cunning. It is later revealed that Damiya was the mastermind driving a wedge between the Queen and the forces of http://anidb.net/ch16880 [Grand Duke].

character.name: Seimiya
character.description: Seimiya is the Granddaughter of the Queen, a beautiful young woman set to inherit the crown. She is a kind and gentle person who, like her grandmother, detests war. Seimiya has deep feelings for Shunan, the Grand Duke`s eldest son.

character.name: Harumiya
character.description: Harumiya is the Queen of Ryoza. She is a gentle woman who shows great compassion towards her country and its people. Her childlike demeanor suggests that she is not familiar with society outside the walls of her home.

character.name: Shunan
character.description: Shunan is the http://anidb.net/ch16880 [Grand Duke]`s eldest son and one of the head captains of the Duke`s Touda Army. He wants to change the country into a reformed society in which the forces of the Grand Duke and the http://anidb.net/ch16877 [Queen] are united.

character.name: Nugan
character.description: Nugan is the brother of http://anidb.net/ch16878 [Shunan], and the second son of the http://anidb.net/ch16880 [Grand Duke]. Nugan has a great respect for his brother, but later feels betrayed by him, partly because of the machinations of the http://anidb.net/ch16877 [Queen]`s nephew, http://anidb.net/ch16875 [Damiya]. He believes that the country is as it should be: the Queen ruling it and the Grand Duke protecting it.

character.name: Oran
character.description: Grand Duke Oran takes pride in fulfilling his duty as a protector of the Queen.

character.name: Mokku
character.description: Once a former thief from the Tai-Koh region, Mokku joins http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin] in her adventures with his partner http://anidb.net/ch16882 [Nukku], in order to repay her for saving their lives.

character.name: Nukku
character.description: Nukku is the taller half of the thief-pair he forms with http://anidb.net/ch16881 [Mokku].

character.name: Esal
character.description: Esal is the Reverend of Teachers at Kazalm.

character.name: Tousana John
character.description: Tousana John is http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin]`s foster father and a beekeeper living in the Shin-Ou region. He used to be a teacher at a very prestigious school, but quit. When he meets Erin, he decides to teach her about beekeeping. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kiriku
character.description: Kiriku is first introduced as an enigmatic new teacher to the Kazalm academy. It is later revealed that he is in fact working under orders from Duke Damiya himself, and is assigned to work undercover in Kazalm. He seems well versed in the art of poisonmaking, and is shown to use these ill skills assasinating the enemies of the Duke. He first sees Erin as a potential weapon, but later wants to protect her because she resembles his dead sister.

character.name: Karisa
character.description: Karisa is the caretaker of the Kazalm academy.

character.name: Kyle
character.description: Kyle is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch16877 [Queen]`s bodyguards, the Sezan. Working under the command of http://anidb.net/ch16874 [Ial], he offers a stark contrast to his commander with his carefree attitude.

character.name: Hagal
character.description: Hagal is a Sezan, one of the Queen`s bodyguards. Witnessing his skills and prowess of his fast feet, he recruits http://anidb.net/ch16874 [Ial] to the sezan, and assumes the role of his mentor. Much later, Hagal is branded as a traitor to the Sezan, and meets his end tragically by the blade of his protegé, Ial.

character.name: Wadan
character.description: Wadan is a Touda doctor of the Ake village. Wadan is shown to hold a deep distrust of the other village`s leading expert on Touda, http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin]`s mother http://anidb.net/ch7453 [Soyon].

character.name: Hasson
character.description: Hasson is the chief of the Ake village, known from it`s Touda breeders. Hasson granted his son Asson the permission to marry a member of the Mist People, http://anidb.net/ch7453 [Soyon], thus making him the grandfather of http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin].

character.name: Nason
character.description: Nason is one of the Mist People, Arryo. It is revealed that he was set to wed Erin`s mother, Soyon. After witnessing Soyon`s death, he starts to watch Erin from the shadows.

character.name: Erin
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin], after a first time-skip, when she`s 14 years old.

character.name: Erin
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch7452 [Erin], after a second time-skip, when she`s 18 years old.

character.name: Tousana John
character.description: Tousana John was a teacher at Tamuyuan Academy, a school only the wealthiest can attend. At that time, he became the reverend of the teachers. He got expelled from the academy after http://anidb.net/ch93824 [Takaran], the bureaucrat, accused him for not believing http://anidb.net/ch93826 [his son] who in return attempted suicide.

episode.title: 緑の目のエリン
Green-eyed Erin
Midori no Me no Erin
episode.summary: Erin is a 10-year-old girl and her mother Soh-yon, a beastinarian who cares for Tohda in the Tai-Koh region in the Village of Ake. After Erin tells her mother that she wants to be a "Tohda doctor" like her, Soh-yon reminds Erin that Tohda are wild animals, something she has yet to learn. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 霧の中の秘密
Secrets of the Mist
Kiri no Naka no Himitsu
episode.summary: Erin hears that Shaju`s older sister has been engaged while watching the dowry from the groom`s village enter the main gates. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闘う獣
The Fighting Beast
Tatakau Kemono
episode.summary: The village prepares to welcome the Grand Duke and a relative of the queen to watch the Tohda`s training. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 医術師のソヨン
Soyon the Healer
Ijutsushi no Soyon
episode.summary: While Erin is with her friends caring for the village goats, she notices a poisonous plant called capracide growing in the fields that could kill the herd. She asks the villagers to help her remove it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ソヨンのぬくもり
Soyon`s Warmth
Soyon no Nukumori
episode.summary: On a rainy night, Soh-yon is summoned to the underground Tohda ponds. There, Soh-yon finds all the Kiba, the Grand Duke`s most prized Tohda, dead... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エリンと卵泥棒
Erin and the Egg Thieves
Erin to Tamago Dorobou
episode.summary: The village prepares for the annual egg hunt in which the village men travel to the swamps to find Tohda eggs. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 母の指笛
A Mother`s Whistle
Haha no Yubibue
episode.summary: Soh-yon is condemned by executed after the Grand Duke`s Kiba mysteriously dies. Erin jumps into a lake full of Tohda in an attempt to save her bleeding mother, but her mother has her taken to safety. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蜂飼(はちか)いのジョウン
Joun the Beekeeper
Hachikai no Joun
episode.summary: Joh-on, a beekeeper in the Shin-Oh region, finds Erin unconscious, floating in the river. He rescues her and nurses her to health, as she attempts to cope with the loss of her mother. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハチミツとエリン
Honey and Erin
Hachimitsu to Erin
episode.summary: While staying with the beekeeper Joh-on, Erin decides to have Joh-on teach her to be an animal breeder and live with him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夜明けの鳥
Dawn Bird
Yoake no Tori
episode.summary: Erin and Joh-on both go to the capital to shop for supplies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とびらの中に
Inside the Gateway
Tobira no Naka ni
episode.summary: Joh-on decides to have his family move to his summer cottage in the mountains. He decides to teach Erin and his children about breeding animals. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白銀の羽
Silver Feather
Hakugin no Hane
episode.summary: Erin finds a large, silver feather in a tree close to Joh-on`s summer cabin high in the mountain. Joh-on tells Erin about the king of beasts, the Ohju, and Erin`s interest in the Ohju begins to grow. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王獣の谷
Valley of the Beast King
Oujuu no Tani
episode.summary: While climbing down a cliff, Joh-on slips and falls onto a ledge of the steep cliff. Erin goes out and finds the hurt Joh-on, and decides to stay with him until the morning. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 霧の民
Mist People
Kiri no Tami
episode.summary: The first recap episode; Nah-son, a scout sent by the Mist Elders to watch over Soh-yon, tells the Elders what happened to Soh-yon and her daughter Erin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふたりの過去
Their Past
Futari no Kako
episode.summary: Joh-on`s son comes and asks his father to become a teacher again. When his son learned that his dad had a young girl living with him, he offered to have her come live with them and have Erin marry-off. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 堅き楯(セ・ザン)のイアル
Ial the Sezan
Sezan no Ial
episode.summary: While in town, Erin accidentally breaks the harp Ia-lu the Seh-zan gave to her when she was 10. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狙われた真王
The Targeted Queen
Nerawareta Shin Ou
episode.summary: At a festival celebrating the Shin-Oh`s birthday, Ia-lu the Seh-zan, along with a baby Ohju, are injured by an assassin`s arrow during an attempt on the Shin-Oh`s life. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 教導師エサル
Instructor Esal
Kyoudoushi Esal
episode.summary: Erin passes the entrance exam and becomes a Kazalm student. There, she meets the Reverend of Teachers at Kazalm, Esal, who is also happens to be an old friend of Joh-on. And with this, Joh-on and Erin say their teary eyed goodbyes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リランという名の王獣
The Beast King Called Lilan
Lilan to Iu Na no Oujuu
episode.summary: Erin`s Professor, Esal decides to let her take care of the baby Ohju Lilan after meeting her. She says that Tomura, the person who is currently talking care of Lilan, is not ready to take care of her yet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えそうな光
Disappearing Light
Kiesou na Hikari
episode.summary: Erin tries to take care of a stubborn Lilan and struggles to put her to sleep. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 竪琴の響き
Echo of the Harp
Tategoto no Hibiki
episode.summary: Erin goes to the capital with Tomura and her two followers, Nuk and Mok, to go back to the Yantoku harp shop and stumble upon Ia-lu who is fighting against two unknown assailants. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カザルムの仲間
Kazalm`s Friend
Kazalm no Nakama
episode.summary: Struggling to fit in with her fellow students, Erin is comforted by a new friend that tells her she can just be herself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カザルムの誓い
Kazalm`s Oath
Kazalm no Chikai
episode.summary: The teachers of Kazalm discuss Erin`s attempts to communicate with Lilan using the harp. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嘆きの歌
Song of Grief
Nageki no Uta
episode.summary: The Grand Duke`s two sons Shunan and Nugan decided to take their own paths after settling it with a duel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふたりのおつかい
Their Errand
Futari no Otsukai
episode.summary: While helping out in Kazalm, Nuk and Mok accidentally lose some gold. Upset at their own actions, they try to earn the money back and make Erin proud. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リランの心
Lilan`s Heart
Lilan no Kokoro
episode.summary: Erin fails a quiz but must re-take it in order to enter high school in Kazalm. Meanwhile, Erin finds out that she means more to Lilan than ever before. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒカラにおちて
Fallen to Hikara
Hikara ni Ochite
episode.summary: Erin starts having nightmares about her mother, Soh-yon who was being taken into "Hikara" the dark part of the afterlife. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジョウンの死
Joun`s Death
Joun no Shi
episode.summary: One morning Erin learns that Joh-on passed away from heart disease. Erin becomes sad but Professor Esal takes her to Joh-on`s hideout when they were still students. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獣の牙
The Beast`s Fangs
Kemono no Kiba
episode.summary: Erin and Lilan bond over grooming but Erin accidentally hurts Lilan which causes an uneasy friendship that they have to fix. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 四年目の冬
The Fourth Winter
Yo Nenme no Fuyu
episode.summary: A recap episode on Erin`s stay at Kazalm; a four year time-skip where Erin is now 18 and a college student. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光の空
Bright Sky
Hikari no Sora
episode.summary: A new teacher, Kirik, comes to Kazalm Academy from the capital. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大罪
Serious Crime
Taizai
episode.summary: Erin is confronted by Nah-Son, an agent sent by the Mist Elders to watch over her. He asks Erin to make a difficult decision that could change the fate of the Ohju. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 飛翔
Flying
Hishou
episode.summary: Erin informs Professor Esal that Lilan can fly. Fearing that she might fly away from Kazalm, Erin has to make a decision for her`s and Lilan`s sake. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あたらしい命
New Life
Atarashii Inochi
episode.summary: Another injured Ohju is delivered to Kazalm, this time it is a wild male who they decided to call "Eku." After a full day with the angry Ohju, Erin manages to gain his trust and communicate to him with her harp. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イアルとエリン
Ial and Erin
Ial to Erin
episode.summary: An injured Ohju is delivered from the Lazal rescue center. Erin realizes the Ohju is something from her past... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 卒舎ノ試し
Final Exam
Sotsusha no Tameshi
episode.summary: Erin and the others take the Graduation Test with all of them passing with Erin taking top scores. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誕生
Birth
Tanjou
episode.summary: Erin officially becomes a Master in the fall and new students come to Kazalm. Of the new students, a girl named Shiron, calls Erin her rival and will stop at nothing to prove herself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真王ハルミヤ
Queen Harumiya
Shin Ou Harumiya
episode.summary: The Shin-Oh decides to visit Kazalm to see Aru. Esal and the faculty decide to keep the Shin-Oh from finding out that Erin uses the harp to communicate with Eku and Lilan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闘蛇の襲撃
Touda Attack
Touda no Shuugeki
episode.summary: While going back to the palace by boat, the Shin-Oh is suddenly attacked by an army of Tohda in the river. It`s up to Erin and Lilan to save them but will they do it in time? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かげりゆく国
Darkening Country
Kageriyuku Kuni
episode.summary: The Shin-Oh is knocked unconscious after the sudden Tohda attack on the boat-ride to the palace while Erin has other ideas about the attack. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真王の真実
The Truth About the Queen
Shin Ou no Shinjitsu
episode.summary: Erin is called to the Kazalm palace, and is asked to accompany the Shin-Oh back to the royal palace with Lilan as bodyguards. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: セィミヤの涙
Seimiya`s Tears
Seimiya no Namida
episode.summary: Word of the Shin-Oh`s sudden death on the way back to the palace has spread, and everyone mourns for the death of their beloved Shin-Oh. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獣ノ医術師
The Beast Doctors
Kemono no Ijutsusha
episode.summary: Beastinarians from Lazal come, learning about Erin`s ability to tame Ohju without the use of a Silent Whistle, and confront Erin about using one as required by law. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アクン・メ・チャイ
Akun Me Chae
Akun Me Chae
episode.summary: As the war between the Shin-Oh and the Tai-Koh regions begins, Erin is called to the palace by Dahmiyah. He orders Erin to create a battalion of Ohju to use for the war. Will Erin oblige? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かごの鳥
A Bird in a Cage
Kago no Tori
episode.summary: Back at the Royal Palace, Kahil tells Ia-lu that Dahmiyah was to wed Shin-Oh Seimiyah. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふたりの絆
The Bond Between the Two
Futari no Kizuna
episode.summary: After being poisoned by Dahmiyah and injured by the Psi-Gamul, Ia-lu seeks refuge at Lazal with Erin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 清らかな夜
Pure Night
Kiyoraka na Yoru
episode.summary: While at the Forest of Purification, Seimiyah is confronted by a large Ohju in the mist. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リョザの夜明け
Dawn at Ryoza
Ryoza no Yoake
episode.summary: It`s the day of the meeting between the Shin-Oh and Tai-Koh. They decide if there will be a war or not. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦
Final Battle
Kessen
episode.summary: The Tai-Koh`s Touda troop advances toward the Shin-Oh, but Seimiyah refuses to go to war with Shunan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獣の奏者
Beast Player
Kemono no Souja
episode.summary: In the final episode, Erin flies Lilan into the battlefield and successfully destroys the Touda army Dahmiyah made. Source: crunchyroll
